# maze environment:
#  Chee, Jan 2014: Added a bounding box! 
#	Otherwise, the robot goes outside the bounding box.
#	
#	SOLUTION 1:
# 	Add four new corners, so the number of points goes from 188 to 192,
#		and number of polygons goes from 47 to 48.
#
#	Add a bounding box that must be "concave" i.e., listed clockwise: 
#	(0,0) --->	(0,512) --->	(512,512) --->	(512,0) --->	(0,0)
#	189		190		191		192 		189
#
#	BUT, this solution messes up the shading of obstacles!
#
#	SOLUTION 2: 
#	Add another four more points,
#	(1,1)   	(1,511)   	(511,511)   	(511,1)   
#	193		194		195		196 	
#	
#	NOW, replace the previous bounding box by four "convex" long trapezoids:
#	
#	(0,0) --->	(1,1) --->	(1,511) --->	(0,512) --->	(0,0)
#	189		193		194		190 		189
#	(0,0) --->	(512,0) --->	(511,1) --->	(1,1) --->	(0,0)
#	189		192		196		193 		189
#	(512,0) --->	(512,512) --->	(511,511) --->	(511,1) --->	(512,0)
#	192		191		195		196 		192
#	(512,512) --->	(0,512) --->	(1,511) --->	(511,511) ---> 	(512,512)
#	191		190		194		195 		191
#
#	Therefore, the number of points is now 196,
#	and number of polygons is 51.
#
# NUMBER OF POINTS:
196
